sn19.16:1.1: “Just now, reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a headless trunk flying through the air.
sn19.16:1.2: Its eyes and mouth were on its chest.
sn19.16:1.3: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing it, pecking and clawing
sn19.16:1.5: “That being used to be an executioner called Hārika right here in Rājagaha. …”
